abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project, which improves
            maintenance of the existing road system by regraveling about
            20 unpaved roads, identifies the main environmental problem
            in Niger as land desertification due to droughts and
            continuous human expansion. This project could aggravate
            this problem by producing the following major negative
            impacts: 1) increased waterborne diseases associated with
            the use of pond water; 2) detriments to the giraffe herd,
            particularly habitat destruction and accidents; 3) disturbed
            forest biotopes caused by opening quarries; 4) water
            erosion; 5) silting from erosion of hill-slope quarries and
            rock outcrops; 6) deforestation caused by overexploitation
            and increased firewood consumption; 7) pollution due to
            dust, exhaust gas emissions, and gasoline, gas-oil, and oil
            vapors; and 8) vehicle noise nuisance. Offsetting measures
            include 1) controlling felling of protected trees and
            protecting sensitive habitats; 2) protecting the giraffe and
            rehabilitating its habitats; 3) combating wind and water
            erosion; 4) limiting vehicle speeds; 5) rehabilitating
            quarries, borrow pits, and watersheds to provide water for
            fauna and agriculture; and 6) conducting population training
            and awareness-arousing programs. Other recommendations will
            be made on drainage and run off water management; soil
            conservation measures such as preventing the high speed flow
            of run off water and improving ground protection by
            planting/replanting trees; establishing vegetation as soil
            and replacing damaged vegetation cover; avoiding locations
            for dumping sand in areas of sand encroachment; and
            identifying sites for seasonal water collection.
